Class Location

  • java.lang.Object
    • Location

  • public class Location
extends java.lang.Object
    Class: SubstringAndLocations
    Description: TheSubstringAndLocations class takes a list of DNASequence objects and a specific subString and searches the DNASequences for the subString. This class keeps track of the location of the subString within the DNASequence and the substring that it searches.

    Author: Marc Kuniansky
    Creation date: May 25, 2015

    Modifications:
    Date Name Reason
    ---- ---- ------
    May 25, 2015, Marc Kuniansky, Implemented the constructors and the toString method.
    May 27, 2015, Marc Kuniansky,
    Version:
    May 27, 2015
    Author:
    Marc Kuniansky, with assistance from Pamela Cutter.

      Getter method used to get the starting location number from a location object.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a location string with the following format: (indexNumber, subSequenceStartLocation) where the index number is the index number from the DNASequence object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Location

        public Location(int indexNum,
                int substringLocation)
        First constructor, where both parameters are ints. The first parameter is an int corresponding to the index number of the DNASequence and the second parameter is an int corresponding to the location of the first character of the subSequence.
        Parameters:
        sequence - Must be a valid int.
        substringLocation - Must be a valid int.

      • Location

        public Location(java.lang.String indexNum,
                java.lang.String substringLocation)
        Second constructor, where both parameters are Strings. The first parameter is a String corresponding to the index number of the DNASequence and the second parameter is an String corresponding to the location of the first character of the subSequence.
        Parameters:
        sequenceNumber - Must be a String which contains only numbers.
        substringLocation - Must be a String which contains only numbers

      • Location

        public Location(java.lang.String indexNum,
                int substringLocation)
        Third constructor, where the first parameter is a String and the second parameter is an int. The first parameter is a String corresponding to the index number of the DNASequence and the second parameter is an int corresponding to the location of the first character of the subSequence.
        Parameters:
        indexNumber - Must be a valid String object which contains only numbers.
        substringLocation - Must be a valid int.

      • Location

        public Location(int indexNum,
                java.lang.String substringLocation)
        Fourth constructor, where the first parameter is an int and the second parameter is a String. The first parameter is an int corresponding to the index number of the DNASequence and the second parameter is a String corresponding to the location of the first character of the subSequence.
        Parameters:
        indexNumber - Must be a valid int.
        substringLocation - Must be a valid String object which contains only numbers.

      • getIndexNumber

        public int getIndexNumber()
        Getter method used to get the index number of a location
        Returns:

        public int getStartLocation()
        Getter method used to get the starting location number from a location object.
        Returns:
        An int starting location.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a location string with the following format: (indexNumber, subSequenceStartLocation) where the index number is the index number from the DNASequence object.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A location as a string.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Used to identify whether one location object is equal to another.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - must be a valid Location object.
        Returns:
        Returns true if both the index number and starting location are equal.
